newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks expect 1st qtr revenues to top estimates.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks expect 1st qtr revenues to top estimates.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc. on Tuesday predicted revenues in its first quarter ending Sept. 26 will top analyst estimates amid strong demand for its products, triggering a surge in the computer network equipment company's stock.

The stock shot up $2.875 to $36.75 in late morning trading on the New York Stock Exchange, where it was one of the biggest percentage gainers and the most actively traded issue on volume of nearly 4.8 million shares.
"Based on bookings for the first seven weeks of the first fiscal quarter ... revenue for the quarter is likely to exceed consensus market expectations," a company statement said.
It added it expected to record more than half of the quarter's revenue in the remaining six weeks of the period, based on historical seasonal trends.
A company spokeswoman was not immediately available to say what Bay networks sees as the market consensus for its first-quarter revenues.
A July 22 First Call poll of 26 analysts put the company's earnings at 16 cents a share for the first quarter ending Sept. 26.
A year earlier, Santa Clara, Calif.-based Bay Networks earned $5.6 million, or 3 cents a share, on revenues of $522.6 million.
Bay Networks makes computer network equipment, including routers and switches, and network management software.
